author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 5

segments.pli: 9. Theravagga
segments.en: 9. Senior Mendicants

segments.pli: 90. Dutiyasekhasutta
segments.en: 90. A Trainee (2nd)

segments.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: “These five things lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Katame pañca?
segments.en: What five?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, sekho bhikkhu bahukicco hoti bahukaraṇīyo viyatto kiṅkaraṇīyesu;
segments.en: Firstly, a mendicant trainee has many duties and responsibilities, and is competent in many tasks.

segments.pli: riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, nānuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ.
segments.en: They neglect retreat, and are not committed to internal serenity of heart.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo dhammo sekhassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the first thing that leads to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sekho bhikkhu appamattakena kammena divasaṃ atināmeti;
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant trainee spends their day doing trivial work.

segments.pli: riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, nānuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ.
segments.en: They neglect retreat, and are not committed to internal serenity of heart.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo dhammo sekhassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the second thing that leads to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sekho bhikkhu saṃsaṭṭho viharati gahaṭṭhapabbajitehi ananulomikena gihisaṃsaggena;
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant trainee mixes closely with laypeople and renunciates, socializing inappropriately like a layperson.

segments.pli: riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, nānuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ.
segments.en: They neglect retreat, and are not committed to internal serenity of heart.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo dhammo sekhassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the third thing that leads to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sekho bhikkhu akālena gāmaṃ pavisati, atidivā paṭikkamati;
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant trainee enters the town at the wrong time, and returns too late in the day.

segments.pli: riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, nānuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ.
segments.en: They neglect retreat, and are not committed to internal serenity of heart.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho dhammo sekhassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the fourth thing that leads to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sekho bhikkhu yāyaṃ kathā ābhisallekhikā cetovivaraṇasappāyā, seyyathidaṃ—
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant trainee doesn’t get to take part in talk about self-effacement that helps open the heart, when they want, without trouble or difficulty. That is,

segments.pli: appicchakathā santuṭṭhikathā pavivekakathā asaṃsaggakathā vīriyārambhakathā sīlakathā samādhikathā paññākathā vimuttikathā vimuttiñāṇadassanakathā, evarūpiyā kathāya na nikāmalābhī hoti na akicchalābhī na akasiralābhī;
segments.en: talk about fewness of wishes, contentment, seclusion, aloofness, arousing energy, ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, and the knowledge and vision of freedom.

segments.pli: riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, nānuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ.
segments.en: They neglect retreat, and are not committed to internal serenity of heart.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, pañcamo dhammo sekhassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the fifth thing that leads to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: These five things lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
segments.en: These five things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Katame pañca?
segments.en: What five?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, sekho bhikkhu na bahukicco hoti na bahukaraṇīyo viyatto kiṅkaraṇīyesu;
segments.en: Firstly, a mendicant trainee doesn’t have many duties and responsibilities, even though they are competent in many tasks.

segments.pli: na riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, anuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ.
segments.en: They don’t neglect retreat, and are committed to internal serenity of heart.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo dhammo sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the first thing that doesn’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sekho bhikkhu na appamattakena kammena divasaṃ atināmeti;
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant trainee doesn’t spend their day doing trivial work.

segments.pli: na riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, anuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ.
segments.en: They don’t neglect retreat, and are committed to internal serenity of heart.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo dhammo sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the second thing that doesn’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sekho bhikkhu asaṃsaṭṭho viharati gahaṭṭhapabbajitehi ananulomikena gihisaṃsaggena;
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant trainee doesn’t mix closely with laypeople and renunciates, socializing inappropriately like a layperson.

segments.pli: na riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, anuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ.
segments.en: They don’t neglect retreat, and are committed to internal serenity of heart.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo dhammo sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the third thing that doesn’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sekho bhikkhu na atikālena gāmaṃ pavisati, nātidivā paṭikkamati;
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant trainee doesn’t enter the village too early or return too late in the day.

segments.pli: na riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, anuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ.
segments.en: They don’t neglect retreat, and are committed to internal serenity of heart.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho dhammo sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the fourth thing that doesn’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sekho bhikkhu yāyaṃ kathā ābhisallekhikā cetovivaraṇasappāyā, seyyathidaṃ—
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant trainee gets to take part in talk about self-effacement that helps open the heart, when they want, without trouble or difficulty. That is,

segments.pli: appicchakathā santuṭṭhikathā pavivekakathā asaṃsaggakathā vīriyārambhakathā sīlakathā samādhikathā paññākathā vimuttikathā vimuttiñāṇadassanakathā, evarūpiyā kathāya nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī;
segments.en: talk about fewness of wishes, contentment, seclusion, aloofness, arousing energy, ethics, immersion, wisdom, freedom, and the knowledge and vision of freedom.

segments.pli: na riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, anuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ.
segments.en: They don’t neglect retreat, and are committed to internal serenity of heart.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, pañcamo dhammo sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: This is the fifth thing that doesn't lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
segments.en: These five things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.”

segments.pli: Dasamaṃ.
Theravaggo catuttho.
Rajanīyo vītarāgo,
kuhakāssaddhaakkhamā;
Paṭisambhidā ca sīlena,
thero sekhā pare duveti.

sections.title: “These five things lead to the decline of a…

suttaplex.blurb: Even if a mendicant is a trainee, they won’t progress if they don’t focus on practice. In detail.
